column2: I am like an infant which has not yet smiled.
column3: I am like an infant which has not yet smiled.

column2: The partial becomes complete; the crooked, straight; the empty, full; the worn out, new.
column3: The partial becomes complete; the crooked, straight; the empty, full; the worn out, new.

column2: He who stands on his tiptoes does not stand firm; he who stretches his legs does not walk (easily). (So), he who displays himself does not shine; he who asserts his own views is not distinguished; he who vaunts himself does not find his merit acknowledged; he who is self-conceited has no superiority allowed to him.
column3: He who stands on his tiptoes does not stand firm; he who stretches his legs does not walk (easily). (So), he who displays himself does not shine; he who asserts his own views is not distinguished; he who vaunts himself does not find his merit acknowledged; he who is self conceited has no superiority allowed to him.

column2: Great, it passes on (in constant flow).
column3: Great, it passes on (in constant flow).

column2: Therefore the Tao is great; Heaven is great; Earth is great; and the (sage) king is also great.
column3: Therefore the Tao is great; Heaven is great; Earth is great; and the (sage) king is also great.

column2: Man takes his law from the Earth; the Earth takes its law from Heaven; Heaven takes its law from the Tao.
column3: Man takes his law from the Earth; the Earth takes its law from Heaven; Heaven takes its law from the Tao.
